author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
I would be happy for new name suggestions.
Seems like a fine name to me, you don't think its good?
I wanted to use SecureIO for the definition of the type which is <:IO (now it is SecureTunnel). But if therer are no issues with the name for the registry I would be happy to keep the name.

> I wanted to use SecureIO for the definition of the type which is <:IO

Ah, in that case the standard name would be `SecureIOs` (cf. e.g. `StaticArrays` which define the type `StaticArray`). But IMO `SecureIO` is a better-looking name. It is up to you really.

I think `SecureIO` is better than `SecureIOs`.

Anyway, can you retrigger Registrator to fix the merge conflict?

[noblock]

I am still thinking about the change of name for the package and the main struct name. Just some ideas popping up:

- SecureIO and SecureTunnel (current)
- SecureIO and SecureStream
- SecureIO and SecureSerializer
- SecureSerializers and SecureSerializer
- CryptoSerializers and CryptoSerializer
- CryptoStreams and CryptoStream
- SecureStreams and SecureStream

I will try to decide on  this in the weekend.

> SecureStreams and SecureStream

I kinda like that. I also don't have a problem with the current names.

Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase

<!-- [noblock] -->

So I decided to keep the name SecureIO, but I will rename type SecureTunnel to SecureSerializer to reflect that it can also be used with a buffer in case one wants to exchange secure messages in old fashion way.
From my point of view, the package could be merged.

> So I decided to keep the name SecureIO, but I will rename type SecureTunnel to SecureSerializer to reflect that it can also be used with a buffer in case one wants to exchange secure messages in old fashion way.

Don't you wanna retrigger to include these changes?
Yes, indeed I can do that. I will retrigger registrator by the the evening.
